resources.string:
General function

Hopefully usage of Coordinate Joker is rather self explanatory:

1. Enter coordinates,
2. Possibly enter projection (mind for unit Meter or feet!), otherwise leave distance and azimuth 0,
3. Set value range for x and
4. send to your desired App with \"View\" or \"Send\".

Entering formulas

When entering formulas you need to pay attention to the following rules: Coordinate Joker replaces the value x within the formulas with the desired values. That operation must result in a mathematically correct formula or number. Therefore an expression like 12.3x5 will work for positive x, but an expression like 12.3(4+x)5 unfortunately won\'t. Strictly speaking, the Geocaching minutes are a decimal number with 3 decimal places: 1*10 + 2*1 + 3*0.1 + (4+x)*0.01 + 5*0.001. You could therefore write the formula like e.g.: 12.305 + (4+x)*0.01 for Coordinate Joker being able to solve it. In addition to the four basic operations Coordinate Joker supports the following mathematical operations:
y^z: exponential function
y%z: modulo operation
abs(y): absolute value
acos(y): arccosine
asin(y): arcsine
atan(y): arctangent
cbrt(y): cubic root
ceil(y): next higher integer
cos(y): cosine
cosh(y): hyperbolic cosine
exp(y): exponential function (base e)
floor(y): next lower integer
log(y): natural logrithm (base e)
log10(y): decimal logarithm (base 10)
log2(y): binary logarithm (base 2)
sin(y): sine
sinh(y): hyperbolic sine
sqrt(y): square root
tan(y): tangent
tanh(y): hyperbolic tangent

Reset

With \"Reset\" you can clear the formula lines. The projection will be reset to 0 and meter units. The value range will be preset to rage 0 to 9.

Export formats

Within the settings menu you can choose between various export formats and behaviors (gpx, kml, kmz, immediate display or sending file).

Settings for Locus Map

All settings \"on\".

The delivery settings (all settings \"on\") generates waypoints in kmz-format incl. an own marker icon and sends them to all apps, that Android offers for displaying that format received in that way. We recommend that you import the points to an own folder which you use exclusively for this purpose. Thus all Coordinate Joker waypoints can be easily shown or hidden all at once.

Settings for c:geo

All settings \"off\".

For c:geo we recommend using the gpx-format. Currently c:geo does not accept receiving the waypoints directly but wants to read them from a file. Therefore you need to select \"off\" for immediate display. The resulting gpx-file then needs to be saved with a file explorer (e.g. to you Download folder) and opened afterwards with c:geo. We recommend that you import the points to an own folder which you use exclusively for this purpose.

Notice: Coordinate Joker shall consciously get along without any Android rights and therefore does not save to the download or other folders. Instead called apps will receive permission to access Coordiante Jokers internally generated files.

Warnings and Errors

Formula errors

An error will be shown if the formulas cannot be solved and produce no result. It can happen, that some x-values result in valid coordinates, while others don\'t. This case will result in a warning about having obtained less points than requested, but the valid points will be shown nevertheless.

Export Problems

Depending on chosen settings Coordinate Joker sends the resulting waypoints in gpx, kml or kmz format to other apps for display. Android will offer apps that claim that they can handle that format. So it depends on one hand on your installed apps whether and which apps are offered to display the waypoints. On the other hand you decide within the Coordinate Joker settings which format will be made available. So don\'t wonder if your favorite geocaching app is not offered in the Android app selection menu, maybe it is simply not capable to receive the chosen format or is restricted to reading waypoints from file. It may even happen that Android does not find any app supporting the format, then you will receive an error message instead of the app selector menu. In any case try alternative settings to find a solution (or try to proceed like described for c:geo above).

A further common problem is that Android may have remembered which app you selected for display and does not offer alternatives anymore, so you don\'t need to repeat the selection again and again. If you nevertheless want to change to another app, you need to reset that remembered association within Android. Details for doing so may vary depending on your Android version and flavor.
